In subgroup Discovery, we are not addressing a multiclass problem, but if we have a multi classification problem, we transform it into a binary classification problem with just two values of the class attribute.

The value of interest, which we call the target class and the opposite, the negative class and then in subgroup discovery we are trying to find patterns individual interpretable patterns in the form of rules which are induced from the data labeled with a predefined property of interest, and then we can learn several subgroup describing patterns from the data.

Relational data mining, as opposed to standard data mining, is characterized by using background knowledge in the data mining process and in particular, instead of dealing with a single input table, we are dealing with a set of interrelated relational tables we could take as an input data warehouse.
Transform it into a set of interrelated tables in a particular format and then we can use a relational data mining algorithm sakte logic.

So relational data mining, as I said, is characterized by taking several input tables and inducing classification models, prediction models, or sets of interesting descriptive patterns.
It is applicable to learning from complex multi relational data as well as learning from complex structured data.
